item.title: LEORA is Now Released!
item.dc:creator: Monds
item.description:
The newest Alter/Ego “LEORA” by VoxWave has now officially been released! If you are not familiar with LEORA, she is a French and English voice bank for the Alter/Ego software. This is the second voice bank by VoxWave, who also created the French and Japanese voice bank “ALYS” for the same engine. She is voiced …

The post LEORA is Now Released! appeared first on VNN.
item.content:encoded:
The newest Alter/Ego “LEORA” by VoxWave has now officially been released! If you are not familiar with LEORA, she is a French and English voice bank for the Alter/Ego software. This is the second voice bank by VoxWave, who also created the French and Japanese voice bank “ALYS” for the same engine. She is voiced by the French YouTaite TBK.

If you liked ALYS, then you will also like LEORA. Not only that, with an English voice bank, English users will be able to finally try out an English Alter/Ego by VoxWave!

She will come with four voice banks:

  • English Core
  • English Power
  • French Core
  • French Power

Note: Currently only her French voice banks is available, however, her English voice banks will be added for free in a later update. She is currently an early access and is still in development.

You can purchase her on VoxWave’s official website for €70,00 EUR ($80 USD) here.

If you want to have an idea of what she sounds like, there is a demo of her as well!

Links

VoxWave’s Official Website

LEORA’s Official Facebook Page

The post LEORA is Now Released! appeared first on VNN.

item.title: VNN Interview with TBK at Dokomi 2017!
item.dc:creator: dotkrawl
item.description:
This year, VoxWave attended Dokomi in Germany! And, of course, it wouldn’t be a full VoxWave party without The Baka Kitsune (TBK), Co-Founder of VoxWave, Youtaite, and voice provider of LEORA. The German division of VNN was lucky enough to be able to ask her a few questions about everything she’s involved in. Here’s VNN’s …

The post VNN Interview with TBK at Dokomi 2017! appeared first on VNN.
item.content:encoded:
This year, VoxWave attended Dokomi in Germany! And, of course, it wouldn’t be a full VoxWave party without The Baka Kitsune (TBK), Co-Founder of VoxWave, Youtaite, and voice provider of LEORA. The German division of VNN was lucky enough to be able to ask her a few questions about everything she’s involved in. Here’s VNN’s interview with TBK!

The Interview

VNN: How are you enjoying Dokomi and Germany so far?

TBK: It’s really great! I came to Germany for the last time five years ago, so I was really happy to be able to come back here. It’s a great time and opportunity to practice my German, too!

 

VNN: Is there anything you personally want to say to your fans?

TBK: Keep loving virtual singers! This team is awesome, okay? And keep doing what you like in life. Everything is good, everything is great!

 

VNN: Regarding your recent work on LEORA, how was recording for you?

TBK: I already did record an UTAU before, my UTAU Guren Nataku, so I was kinda used to the process. But it was also different with LEORA because we wanted it to be really precise and Drak-pa kept telling me to re-record samples because we needed to have the phoneme sounds to be really precise and specific. So it was a bit longer. We took like an entire weekend to record the French and I still have to record the English, which will be the hardest part, but I really enjoyed it!

I’m pretty surprised because LEORA actually has a beautiful high lyrical voice and really beautiful high notes, and I just have recorded a medium voice range, so I’m kinda confused. I have no idea where they come from, but it’s cool because it’s kinda complimentary? I can’t sing high notes very well and she can sing them for me, which is really cool.

VNN: What was your first reaction when you heard LEORA for the first time?

TBK: Joffrey told me, “Oh, I can hear your voice in LEORA,” and I was like, “Oh, really?” because I’m so used to my raw natural voice during the recording process, so it feels completely different for me to hear it through a voice synthesizer. I really don’t see LEORA as a copy of my voice, really not! I think it’s a new being, a new entity. It’s really interesting.

 

VNN: How would you describe the relationship between LEORA and ALYS?

TBK: We made LEORA as kind of an “Alter/Ego,” if I can say it like that, of ALYS so that she can be everything you want her to be! Some people see them as lovers, others as best friends or even enemies. I personally see it as they’re from the same world, so they’re just here together. I like all of the things that they can do together?

 

VNN: And how would you describe YOUR personal relationship with LEORA?

TBK: Uhm, that’s a hard one. I see her like she is a part of me. She’s everything I can’t do in public. I like to see her as a warrior, as a berserker, and a strong woman! Sometimes I’m angry and I can’t really publicly say, “I want to destroy it!” But I feel like LEORA has this attitude where she would say it. I like her; she is my girl, my fighting girl. She’s our girl with VoxWave and everyone’s girl.

 

VNN: If you could say something to LEORA in person, what would that be?

TBK: Never give up.

 

VNN: Would you like to perform some day with her side by side?

TBK: Yes, definitely! To be honest, I already asked Joffrey to do a duet song with LEORA because I really think it would be great and, as I said, she has beautiful high notes. So I think I can do the low parts and she can take over the high parts. I really want to try it!

 

VNN: What do you wish for LEORA in the future?

TBK: I hope that people will welcome her just like they did with ALYS. She isn’t here to replace ALYS; she’s here to help her! She’s here to bring forth a new part of their universe. So I really hope people will enjoy LEORA and make songs with her. I just want her to bring something to people.

Follow TBK

You can follow TBK on the following websites:

Official Website
YouTube
Facebook
Twitter

Follow VoxWave

In addition, you can follow VoxWave on these websites:

Official Website
Facebook
Twitter
YouTube
NND

The post VNN Interview with TBK at Dokomi 2017! appeared first on VNN.

item.title: ALYS and Yan Xi Available on Zyon!
item.dc:creator: Monds
item.description:
A new update is now available on Zyon, and this time around, it is the French virtual singer ALYS, created by VoxWave! The pack includes the songs “Hajime Ni,” “SHARDS,” “Neutrino,” and “Sous Cette Pluie” performed by ALYS as well as her very own theme. You also have a chance to win a “Zyon Emblem” which …

The post ALYS and Yan Xi Available on Zyon! appeared first on VNN.
item.content:encoded:
A new update is now available on Zyon, and this time around, it is the French virtual singer ALYS, created by VoxWave! The pack includes the songs “Hajime Ni,” “SHARDS,” “Neutrino,” and “Sous Cette Pluie” performed by ALYS as well as her very own theme.

You also have a chance to win a “Zyon Emblem” which gives you access to all of the songs by sharing Zyon‘s Facebook post.

New update featuring ALYS theme for free.Come and see this sweet French virtual idol performing her wonderful voice in…

Posted by Zyon 載音 on Friday, May 26, 2017

Another recent addition to Zyon is Yan Xi. Who is Yan Xi, you ask? Yan Xi is a Chinese virtual singer from the MUTA synthesizer software.

On top of all this, several new Luo Tianyi and YanHe songs have also been made available!

Zyon is currently available on Android and iOS.

For more information on Zyon, check out our page here.

Official Links

VoxWave’s Website
Yan Xi’s Website

The post ALYS and Yan Xi Available on Zyon! appeared first on VNN.

item.title: Leora Voice Sample Released
item.dc:creator: Monds
item.description:
If you are familiar with the Alter/Ego voice bank “ALYS,” then you have most likely heard of LEORA. But if not, let us do a small introduction! LEORA is VoxWave‘s second voice bank and is meant to complement ALYS. Like ALYS, she will be a French virtual singer for the software Alter/Ego. We currently do not …

The post Leora Voice Sample Released appeared first on VNN.
item.content:encoded:
If you are familiar with the Alter/Ego voice bank “ALYS,” then you have most likely heard of LEORA. But if not, let us do a small introduction!

LEORA is VoxWave‘s second voice bank and is meant to complement ALYS. Like ALYS, she will be a French virtual singer for the software Alter/Ego. We currently do not have much information on her, but we do know that she is currently in development and that she is voiced by TBK.

You can find her voice samples below. Keep in mind that this is only a pre-Alpha version. The song is actually a cover of an ALYS song, and you can find the song here.

LEORA’s Facebook Page

VoxWave’s Official Website

The post Leora Voice Sample Released appeared first on VNN.

item.title: ALYS Song and Design Contest
item.dc:creator: Monds
item.description:
For ALYS’ 3rd anniversary, VoxWave has opened up a song and a design contest! Both contests will be held from March 10th, 2017, (00:01 GMT+1) to April 30th, 2017 (23:59 GMT+1). The prizes for the design contest will be the following: 1st Place (Grand Prix): The winner’s illustration will be printed on a limited edition …

The post ALYS Song and Design Contest appeared first on VNN.
item.content:encoded:
For ALYS’ 3rd anniversary, VoxWave has opened up a song and a design contest! Both contests will be held from March 10th, 2017, (00:01 GMT+1) to April 30th, 2017 (23:59 GMT+1).

The prizes for the design contest will be the following:

1st Place (Grand Prix): The winner’s illustration will be printed on a limited edition sketchpad. Their (artist) name will be written on the back of the sketchpad with “1st place of the ALYS is 3 years old contest.” 5,000 sketchpads will be produced for France and foreign countries. A part of it will be sold by VoxWave and Clairefontaine.

Clairefontaine will provide the winner with stationery supplies for the coming year (€500 EUR of supplies, all taxes included), and VoxWave will provide the winner with ALYS merchandise (up to €100 EUR, all taxes included) along with a Rêve de Machine CD.

*First place is worth €600 EUR of prizes!

2nd Place (Two Special Mentions): Clairefontaine will provide the winner with stationery supplies for the coming year (€500 EUR of supplies, all taxes included), and VoxWave will provide the winner with ALYS merchandise (up to €60 EUR, all taxes included) along with a Rêve de Machine CD.

*Special mentions are worth 2 x €560 EUR of prizes!

The prizes for the song contest will be the following:

1st Place: The winner will have their song selected for an upcoming ALYS album and will win for this purpose a musician-composer contract with us! They will also win a software license or their choice of being published by Plogue or VoxWave, along with a €100 EUR discount on VoxWave’s ALYS merchandise! For this, another prize needs to be added, and it’s a really nice gift from Image-Line: a “Signature Bundle” license of the FL Studio software, worth €289 EUR.

2nd Place: The winner will receive a €50 EUR discount on ALYS merchandise in VoxWave’s e-shop, along with a “Producer Edition” license of the FL Studio software by Image-Line, worth €189 EUR.

3rd Place: The winner will receive a €25 EUR discount on ALYS merchandise in VoxWave’s e-shop, along with a “Fruity Edition” license of the FL Studio software by Image-Line, worth €89 EUR.

For all contest rules and information for the design contest, click here. For the song contest, click here.

The post ALYS Song and Design Contest appeared first on VNN.

item.title: Draw for the ALYS Chistmas PV 2016!
item.dc:creator: Hoshi
item.description:
Celebrations of the end of the year are coming and, like every year since ALYS’ announcement, VoxWave is letting fans join in on the creation of the ALYS Christmas PV! It’s a way for them to celebrate the community and their long journey so far. After “Pr☆messe” and “Lupin’s Night,” VoxWave wants you to join in on the creation of the …

The post Draw for the ALYS Chistmas PV 2016! appeared first on VNN.
item.content:encoded:
Celebrations of the end of the year are coming and, like every year since ALYS’ announcement, VoxWave is letting fans join in on the creation of the ALYS Christmas PV! It’s a way for them to celebrate the community and their long journey so far.

After “Pr☆messe” and “Lupin’s Night,” VoxWave wants you to join in on the creation of the “A l’aube de ce jour de Noël” (At the dawn of Christmas Day) PV. This song was made by Anthony Lo Re, winner of the VOCALYS1 composition contest and composer of “Dilection” and “Le Paradoxe de ma vie.”

How to Enter

To enter, you need to send VoxWave an email (contact@voxwave.fr) with the following information before December 6th:

– Your name or nickname which will be used for crediting purposes.
– Age (minors need written parent or guardian permission to enter).
– Illustration with a minimum size of 800×800 pixels, in .jpg or .png extension (no transparent backgrounds please).
– The following sentence: “I hereby authorize VoxWave company to use my illustration for “A l’aube de ce jour de Noël” PV and for its promotion. I read the participation conditions.”

As regard to the theme, the only limitation is the title of the song. You can use whatever character from the universe created by VoxWave in any outfit, either official or original.

By sending your entry, you authorize VoxWave to put your illustration in ALYS’ next PV and in promotional content for the PV (flyers, web reproduction, etc.). No other use will be done without explicitly asking you.

You can read the participation conditions here. Feel free to email VoxWave for a translation and/or more details.

You can also send VoxWave entries for the exhibition that will be held at Le Dernier bar avant la fin du monde in Paris before the “Rêve de Machine” show. You have until November 15th and should send an A4 picture with 300 dpi quality.

Original Article

The post Draw for the ALYS Chistmas PV 2016! appeared first on VNN.

item.title: VNN’s Partnership with VoxWave!
item.dc:creator: Monds
item.description:
As many of you know, we have recently added VNN in French to our list of languages, and with that said, we have an announcement: VNN will now be partnered with VoxWave! We would love to have a hub for the French community as well as to help spread the word of the virtual singer ALYS and the upcoming …

The post VNN’s Partnership with VoxWave! appeared first on VNN.
item.content:encoded:
As many of you know, we have recently added VNN in French to our list of languages, and with that said, we have an announcement: VNN will now be partnered with VoxWave! We would love to have a hub for the French community as well as to help spread the word of the virtual singer ALYS and the upcoming voice bank, LEORA.

 

Who is ALYS?

ALYS is a French and Japanese virtual singer using the software Alter/Ego and is created by VoxWave. She is the first French virtual singer for Alter/Ego and was released on March 10th, 2016. She was voiced by Poucet and illustrated by Saphirya.

 

 

Who is LEORA?

LEORA is VoxWave’s second voice bank. She is voiced by TBK and illustrated by Saphirya. She is still in development.

We hope that this will help us reach out to the French community as well as ensure that we have the most accurate and up-to-date information on both of these virtual singers, both of whom we will be covering from now on.

We look forward to working closely with the French community and VoxWave!

VoxWave’s Official Website

VoxWave’s Official Facebook

ALYS’ Official Facebook

LEORA’s Official Facebook

The post VNN’s Partnership with VoxWave! appeared first on VNN.
